text: much-needed food is being brought into
the South of Haiti many communities are
becoming increasingly desperate
electricity cut off water and food are
scarce the country was already in the
grip of a cholera epidemic and the
warnings are stark if AIDS does not
reach people quickly disease will spread
famine will become inevitable the town
of GME was all but destroyed here the
United Nations children's charity UNICEF
is trying to help
they say 66 thousand houses in this town
alone have been destroyed and schools
are being used as shelters among the
hardest hit the youngest this juror is
13 he told her his family lost
everything a tin roof flew away
roofs and tree branches flew away water
started coming in things were flying
everywhere the water surrounded us that
night it almost reached us we were able
to get out left all our things behind we
had to get them from a ditch 15 year old
Levinson described what he saw the wind
the wind all the coconut trees were
destroyed all sorts of trees fell down
the wid destroyed everyone's house and
this is seven year old Erika all my
schoolbooks were ruined this clinic in
the small town of Mar franck
this father has just been told his child
has collar the UN says seven hundred and
fifty thousand people in the country
need help this will cost around one
hundred and twenty million dollars
crops were destroyed which means the
country will face a severe famine as the
southwestern Peninsula is considered the
breadbasket of Haiti so the needs are
urgent
hurricane Mathieu may be long gone from
Haiti but the damage it has done remains
and if Aid does not reach the most
vulnerable soon
the situation threatens to get even
worse Cucina anton BBC news
